projects1.title: Solar System
projects1.description: This project was the first project we did using JQuery. We were tasked to create a web application that would take each planet in the solar system and list the title on a card. When you hovered over the card, a picture of the planet would appear. When you click on the planet it would pop up a fullscreen modal that would give descriptions and facts about the planet. It also has a search bar on the main page where you can search for keywords and planets.
projects1.technologiesUsed: HTML5, CSS, Javascript, jQuery, Sass, NPM, Webpack, and Version Control with Github

project2.title: My Tamagotchi Pet Web Application
project2.description: The web application is divided into quadrants. Each quadrant has a different background color and represents a different activity that you can perform which are: Eat, Play, Sleep and Fight. Each quadrant has a progress bar that will show the status of the pet's level's. There is also an overall status bar in the middle which takes in the average of the 4 quadrants to also show the overall status of the pet.
project2.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Sass, NPM, Webpack, and Version Control with Github

project3.title: Shark Attack Web Application
project3.description: This application was my introduction to React. The application is divided up into two sections, Shark Tank and Graveyard. The students from class are loaded in the Shark Tank and shark attack button randomizes a student being eaten and sent to the Graveyard.
project3.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, NPM, Firebase, Bootstrap, Sass, React and Version Control with Github.

project4.title: Pinterest
project4.description: This application is a riff off of the popular app Pinterest. When you first go to the site you will be prompted to log in with Google Authentication. The app allows users to create their own boards to save links and images to. The project utilizes full CRUD to be able to add, delete, and update thier boards and links
project4.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, jQuery, Webpack, Firebase, NPM, Axios, Bootstrap, Sass, and Version Control with Github.
